title: Domaine des Valanges 2016 Hors Classe En Crêches  (Saint-Véran)
description: From a single vineyard, this wine is generous and ripe with red apples and a touch of spice. It is young, with a strong mineral edge that gives a zesty citrus tang. At the same time, the acidity and the fruitiness are developing well. Drink from mid-2018.

title: Castellroig 2013 Brut Nature Reserva Sparkling (Cava)
description: Aromas of pear cider are mild yet focused on the nose. Fresh acidity drives the scrubbing palate, while this brut nature tastes of green apple, white corn and mild citrus fruits. An clean, dry finish makes for a nice ending.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Broad aromas of white peach and nectarine are lifted with hints of Key lime zest on the pleasant nose of this bottling. There is impressive zip to the well-structured and grippy sip, where fresh citrus juice keeps the tropical passion fruit and guava flavors in check.

title: Château Desmirail 2015  Margaux
description: Piled high with new wood, dark-chocolate flavors and dryness, this wine will be a tough call for many years. It will show better, although the over-indulgent use of wood will likely always keep it dry.

title: Alto Moncayo 2014 Veraton Garnacha (Campo de Borja)
description: Lactic oak is the dominant aroma on this Garnacha, which results in creamy notes of chocolate atop plum and cassis scents. This is woody and resiny in feel, with ample acidity to maintain balance. Savory, smoky plum and blackberry flavors are baked and woody, while this tastes of beef jerky and other cured meats on the finish. Drink through 2020.

title: Andrew Rich 2014 Red Willow Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: From one of the state's premier vineyards, this shows high-toned dried herb, plum and spice aromas followed by palate-coating fruit flavors. It has a lovely feel and balance that carries through the finish.

title: Birichino 2015 Malvasia Bianca (Monterey)
description: Extremely light in the glass, this bottling explodes with orange blossom, lemon oil and beeswax on the nose. It's very dry and tight on the palate, where jasmine and apple blossoms dominate.

title: Birichino 2016 Pétulant Naturel Malvasia Bianca (Monterey)
description: Cloudy in the glass, Pétulant is redolent with yellow grapefruit aromas, as well as some cut pear. The foam is very aggressive upon sipping, with lots of creamy qualities that are soft rather than sharp. Flavors of sour grapefruit and lemon rind are fun rather than funky.

title: Chateau Ste. Michelle 2016 Riesling (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine bursts with ripe peach, honeysuckle and jasmine aromas. It drinks off-dry, the palate redolent of juicy stone fruit and mouthwatering acidity. The balance is exquisite. More, please!

title: Castillo Clavijo 2010 Gran Reserva  (Rioja)
description: Light, spicy aromas of mature, leafy berry fruits and herbs lead to a juicy and fresh palate. On the flavor side, this is dry and spicy, with tea, pepper and leafy berry notes that stay peppery and spicy on the finish.

title: Domaine de Bellene 2015  Savigny-lès-Beaune
description: This wine is crisp with great green and citrus fruits. It is structured and mineral, with acidity that gives a bright texture. A touch of spice from wood aging adds complexity. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: Château Corbin 2015 Divin de Corbin  (Saint-Émilion)
description: The second wine of Château Corbin, this is ripe and rounded. It's a juicy Merlot, with generous tannins and smooth blackberry fruit. It has a dense texture as well as a dry core that will allow the wine to age. Drink from 2019.

title: Domaine Gueguen 2016  Chablis
description: This fruity vintage yields crisp-textured wines. Offering citrus and creamed-apple flavors, this wine gains further lift from its acidity and light touch of spice. It's lively, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Domaine Julie Belland 2015 Comme Dessus  (Santenay)
description: At a high point in the Santenay vineyards, Comme Dessus produces a balanced, cool and collected wine. Yellow fruits are balanced by good acidity and a juicy apple and pear aftertaste. Drink from 2019.

title: Dr. Nägler 2015 Estate Bottled Trocken Pinot Noir (Rheingau)
description: Ripe black cherry and berry tones abound in this plump Pinot Noir. It's more juicy than complex but hints of dark toast and hazelnut lend nuance. Fresh cranberry acidity and fine, persistent tannins add firmness to the finish. Drink now through 2019.

title: Dr. Nägler 2016 Rüdesheimer Berg Rottland Spätlese Riesling (Rheingau)
description: Savory notes of earth and bramble juxtapose prettier blossom, yellow peach and apricot in this crisp, concentrated medium-sweet Riesling. It's a juicy, sweet-tart wine bursting with tangy citrus acidity and a slightly phenolic finish. Drink now through 2020.

title: Dracaena 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Plenty of pepper and dark red cherry aromas meet with crushed asphalt, beef char and a touch of tar on the nose of this bottling. There is decent energy to the sip, where roasted black cherry, pepper-crusted beef and hints of rosewater and oregano make for a very quaffable wine, perfect for backyard barbecues.

title: El Enemigo 2015 Bonarda (Mendoza)
description: Earthy, baked aromas of dark berry fruits and wood spice lead to a wide but slightly flimsy palate in this wine. Its herbal plum, leather and toast aromas contain a desiccated note of prune. Yet, it finishes full and fleshy. Drink through 2020.

title: Friedrich-Wilhelm-Gymnasium 2016 Fritz Willi Trocken Riesling (Mosel)
description: Sunny pineapple, mango and tangerine aromas lend a distinctly tropical feel to this fresh and fruity dry Riesling. It's juicy and primary in style but boasts a hint of minerality and a spine tingling lime finish. Drink now through 2021.

title: Gantenbein 2014 Pinot Noir (Graubünden)
description: This Swiss Pinot Noir has aromas of smoked meats, blueberries and black plums. In the mouth there are flavors of black cherry and plum. It is well balanced on the palate and the finish is smooth with a persistent aftertaste of fresh fruit.

title: Iris Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (Willamette Valley)
description: There's a steely tightness to this wine, which keeps it focused on bright apple and white peach fruit. It spent 10 months in just 15% new oak, mostly French.

title: Kokomo 2015 Timber Crest Vineyard Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Juicy red fruit is powerfully wound around a core of toasted oak and blueberry cobbler richness in this vineyard-designate, which finishes ripe and round.

title: La Honda Winery 2015 Salinian Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Heavy cedar and incense aromas meet with blackberry and dark chocolate on the nose of this block-designated Cab. The palate is dominated by savory wood flavors of charred oak along with bay leaf, oregano, cocoa dust, black olive and a red-fruit core.

title: Le Vigne di Eli 2015 Rosso  (Etna)
description: Fresh and refined, this offers aromas of crushed rock, underbrush, dark berry and culinary spice. It's lithely structured, with strawberry, red cherry, crushed herb and star anise. Drink through 2021.

title: Marqués de Gelida 2014 Brut Reserva Pinot Noir Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: This brut rosé is light in color and equally light on the nose, with mild aromas of creamy orange, powdered sugar and red currant. A flyweight palate with citric acidity deals mild tangerine and nectarine flavors prior to a slight finish with crisp acidity.

title: Monte del Frà 2015 Lena di Mezzo  (Valpolicella Classico Superiore Ripasso)
description: Mature blackberry, vanilla and baked-plum aromas take center stage. This wine is concentrated and smooth, with black cherry, white pepper and cinnamon flavors set against velvety tannins. It's also surprisingly fresh for the hot vintage. Enjoy through 2023.

title: Muscardini 2014 Unti Vineyard Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the well-known vineyard in the appellation, this is made entirely from the variety, and it has a texture and flavor of fruit leather, plum and dried cherry, as well as an herbal earthy note of tomato leaf. The tannins are a tad harsh, but mellow in the glass.

title: Pali 2015 Highlands Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fairly showy white flower aromas meet with melted butter, lemon rind candy and match smoke on the nose of this appellation blend. There are a good amount of smoky oak and roasted marshmallow flavors to the sip, but they are cut deftly by fresh citrusy acidity.

title: Plumb Cellars 2013 Damn Straight Red (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: This wine is a blend of Cabernet Sauvignon (60%), Cabernet Franc (20%), Merlot (12%) and Syrah. Black cherry, raspberry, cedar, vanilla and barrel spice aromas lead to full-bodied dark fruit flavors that coat the palate from end to end, with barrel notes that linger on the finish. Firm tannins provide support.

title: Point Ormond 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Frankland River)
description: This wine is a pretty, delicate time capsule of the cool climes of the Frankland River subregion of Western Australia's Great Southern. White blossoms, peach, pineapple, green apple and lime popsicle abound. The palate is feather light and not lacking in this region's trademark levels of acidity.
